revised_title: Microscopic Observations on Chalky Tubulous Concretions and Farina of the Red Lily
tldr: The author investigates chalky tubulous concretions called Malm and examines the farina of the red lily through a microscope. He suggests that Malm may form by enclosing and investing pieces of wood with additional layers, while the farina of the red lily ejects small globules in a continuous train.
